chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
items.plainText: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

items.text: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
items.plainText: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

items.text: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
items.plainText: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

items.text: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.
items.plainText: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.

items.text: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
items.plainText: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

items.text: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.
items.plainText: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.

items.text: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
items.plainText: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

items.text: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
items.plainText: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

items.text: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
items.plainText: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

items.text: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.
items.plainText: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

items.text: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
items.plainText: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

items.text: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:
items.plainText: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:

items.text: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
items.plainText: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

items.text: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.
items.plainText: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.

items.text: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.
items.plainText: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.

items.text: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
items.plainText: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)

items.text: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
items.plainText: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

items.text: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.
items.plainText: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

items.text: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
items.plainText: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.

items.text: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.
items.plainText: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.

items.text: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
items.plainText: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

items.text: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
items.plainText: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
